summary: This is a formal 'Notification of Identified Victims' from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to Jeffrey Epstein, issued pursuant to a deferred prosecution agreement. It lists 30 Jane Doe victims the government was prepared to name in a federal indictment and notifies Epstein that these individuals retain the right to sue him for damages under federal law. The document is signed by U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta and acknowledged by Epstein and his attorney Roy Black.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual who entered a guilty plea to state charges of solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He is the subject of the deferred prosecution agreement and this notification of identified victims.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida who signed the official notification document.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, who witnessed Epstein's acknowledgment of the notification and is noted as the attorney with whom Epstein discussed the document.

connections.description: Roy Black is identified as Epstein's attorney, who received, discussed, and witnessed Epstein's acknowledgment of the victim notification document.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, signed the official notification to Epstein as part of the deferred prosecution agreement between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in Palm Beach County Circuit Court to felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He was sentenced to 18 months' imprisonment followed by probation.

events.title: Issuance of Victim Notification
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida issued this formal notification to Jeffrey Epstein, listing 30 identified Jane Doe victims, as required by the deferred prosecution agreement.

locations: 500 South Australian Ave., Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally identified 30 minor victims (listed as Jane Doe #1 through #30) of Jeffrey Epstein who were prepared to be named in a federal indictment.

The document confirms the existence of a deferred prosecution agreement between Epstein and the U.S. Attorney's Office, which allowed Epstein to avoid federal indictment while granting victims the right to sue him for damages under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255.
The notification states that each identified victim is deemed to have sustained damages of no less than $150,000 and can sue Epstein in federal court.
U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta signed the document, and Epstein's attorney Roy Black witnessed Epstein's acknowledgment of it.
The document was created as a result of Epstein's June 30, 2008, state court guilty plea to soliciting prostitution and procuring minors for prostitution.
